metadata.title: USN-5461-1 -- FreeRDP vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled empty password values. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass server authentication. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2022-24882)  It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled server configurations with an invalid SAM file path. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass server authentication. (CVE-2022-24883)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5461-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 freerdp2-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libwinpr2-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libuwac0-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
